org.bonitasoft.engine.search

Class SearchOptionsBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bonitasoft.engine.search.SearchOptionsBuilder

  • public class SearchOptionsBuilder
extends Object
    Builder for SearchOptions objects. It can be used to define paged searches returning SearchResults. When several filters are added, implicit AND operators are used if not specified. See SearchOptions for deeper details on search mechanism options.
    Author:
    Matthieu Chaffotte, Emmanuel Duchastenier, Celine Souchet
    See Also:
    SearchOptions

    • Constructor Detail

      • SearchOptionsBuilder

        public SearchOptionsBuilder(int startIndex,
                    int maxResults)
        Builds a new SearchOptions with results limited to startIndex and maxResults. If you are interested only in the number of elements matching with the given criteria without knowing the elements details, it's possible to use zero as maxResults: SearchResult.getResult() will send an empty list and SearchResult.getCount() will return the number of matching elements.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - the first result to return
        maxResults - the maximum results to return. The actual number can be smaller, if the end of the list has been reached.
        See Also:
        SearchOptions, SearchResult.getResult(), SearchResult.getCount()

      • SearchOptionsBuilder

        public SearchOptionsBuilder(SearchOptions searchOptions)
        Creates a new SearchOptionsBuilder from another instance by
        Parameters:
        searchOptions -

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public SearchOptionsBuilder filter(String field,
                          Serializable value)
        Filter the results to the specific value for the specific field (equality)
        Parameters:
        field - The name of the field to filter on. Depending on the search parameter, specify the field by accessing the relevant xxxSearchDescriptor classes. For example, HumanTaskInstanceSearchDescriptor.NAME and HumanTaskInstanceSearchDescriptor.PROCESS_DEFINITION_ID.
        value - the single value to filter on that field name
        Returns:
        this builder itself
        Since:
        6.0

        value - the value to compare.
        Returns:
